requirements_addressed: Test: guardkit system-plan with --context flag passes context file to run_system_plan()
Test: guardkit system-overview invokes get_system_overview() and returns output
Test: guardkit graphiti search passes query string to search function
Tests use click.testing.CliRunner to invoke commands directly (no subprocess needed)
Tests verify the command produced meaningful output (not empty, not just a help message)
All tests pass with pytest tests/seam/test_cli_to_python.py -v
requirements_remaining: Test: guardkit task create with title creates a task file in the correct directory (BLOCKED - CLI command does not exist)

completion_promises.evidence: Created tests/seam/test_cli_to_python.py with 16 tests organized into 4 test classes (TestSystemPlanSeam, TestSystemOverviewSeam, TestGraphitiSearchSeam, TestErrorHandling)

completion_promises.criterion_text: Test: guardkit system-plan with --context flag passes context file to run_system_plan()
completion_promises.evidence: test_system_plan_passes_context_file_to_entry_point verifies context_file argument is passed correctly by mocking _run_system_plan and capturing the kwargs

completion_promises.criterion_text: Test: guardkit system-overview invokes get_system_overview() and returns output
completion_promises.evidence: test_system_overview_invokes_get_system_overview_and_returns_output verifies the function is called and output contains expected system name or SYSTEM OVERVIEW header

completion_promises.criterion_text: Test: guardkit graphiti search passes query string to search function
completion_promises.evidence: test_graphiti_search_passes_query_string_to_search_function captures search calls and verifies 'authentication patterns' query is passed correctly

completion_promises.criterion_text: Test: guardkit task create with title creates a task file in the correct directory
completion_promises.evidence: CLI command 'guardkit task create' does not exist in the codebase. Task creation is handled by Claude Code slash commands (/task-create). A documentation note has been added to the test file explaining this.

completion_promises.criterion_text: Tests use click.testing.CliRunner to invoke commands directly (no subprocess needed)
completion_promises.evidence: All tests use CliRunner fixture and runner.invoke(cli, [...]) pattern for direct command invocation without subprocess

completion_promises.criterion_text: Tests verify the command produced meaningful output (not empty, not just a help message)
completion_promises.evidence: All tests assert result.output.strip() is not empty and contains expected content (system names, search results, etc.)

completion_promises.criterion_text: All tests pass with pytest tests/seam/test_cli_to_python.py -v
completion_promises.evidence: Ran pytest tests/seam/test_cli_to_python.py -v and all 16 tests passed (see test_output_summary)
